required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Chart Review of BOTOX® and Xeomin® for the Treatment of Cervical Dystonia and Blepharospasm

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a retrospective chart review to evaluate the doses of botulinum Type A toxins BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) and Xeomin® (incobotulinumtoxinA) used for the treatment of Cervical Dystonia and Blepharospasm in clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose of Botulinum Toxin Used to Treat Cervical Dystonia
primary_outcome.description: The average dose of botulinum toxin received per patient per year was calculated.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose of Botulinum Toxin Used to Treat Blepharospasm
primary_outcome.description: The average dose of botulinum toxin received per patient per year was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease documented in the medical chart that occurred after treatment with botulinum toxin, or pre-existing conditions that worsened during the retrospective period.
Injection-interval was the time in weeks between injections of botulinum toxin.

arm_group.description: Retrospective chart review of doses of BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) used as standard of care in clinical practice. No treatment (intervention) was administered.
Retrospective chart review of doses of Xeomin® (incobotulinumtoxinA) used as standard of care in clinical practice. No treatment (intervention) was administered.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with cervical dystonia or blepharospasm previously treated with Xeomin® and BOTOX®.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed primary diagnosis of idiopathic cervical dystonia or blepharospasm for at least 2 years
- treatment with Xeomin® and BOTOX® for at least 1 year each
Exclusion Criteria:
- having a neuromuscular junction transmission disorder or taking any medications that could affect neuromuscular junction transmission
- previous surgical procedure involving bone or muscle for the management of cervical dystonia or blepharospasm

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Retrospective chart review of doses of BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) and Xeomin® (incobotulinumtoxinA) used as standard of care in clinical practice. No treatment (intervention) was administered.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Retrospective chart review of doses of BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) and Xeomin® (incobotulinumtoxinA) used as standard of care in clinical practice. No treatment (intervention) was administered.

outcome.title: Dose of Botulinum Toxin Used to Treat Cervical Dystonia
outcome.description: The average dose of botulinum toxin received per patient per year was calculated.
outcome.population: Participants diagnosed with Cervical Dystonia who received onabotulinumtoxinA for 2 years and incobotulinumtoxinA for 2 years.

group.description: Retrospective chart review of doses of BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) used as standard of care in clinical practice. No treatment (intervention) was administered.

outcome.description: The average dose of botulinum toxin received per patient per year was calculated.
outcome.population: Participants diagnosed with Blepharospasm who received onabotulinumtoxinA for 2 years and incobotulinumtoxinA for 2 years.

measure.description: The average dose of botulinum toxin received per patient per year was calculated.
measure.population: Participants diagnosed with Blepharospasm who received onabotulinumtoxinA for 2 years and incobotulinumtoxinA for 2 years.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: An Adverse Event was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease documented in the medical chart that occurred after treatment with botulinum toxin, or pre-existing conditions that worsened during the retrospective period.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of botulinum toxin.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
